page.title: 17Wormleighton Parish Church
page.content: The Church which is dedicated to St. Peter, dates from the early 12th century. There are traces of that period in the nave. Early in the 13th century the tower and aisles were built and the chancel rebuilt. In the 15th century the nave roof was raised to permit the building of the clerestory. There is a noteworthy chancel screen of the same period and several hatchments on the west wall of the nave which probably date from the early 17th century. Today the church belongs to a multiple benefice which includes Priors Hardwick, Priors Marston, Fenny Compton and Avon Dassett. In spite of this there are services every two weeks alternately Holy Communion and Matins, and a joint service with Priors Marston or Priors Hardwick is held on the fifth Sunday. The attendance averages 10 or 12.
